FuncDef:
The nat server-mode enable command enables the address-based NAT server mode.
The undo nat server-mode enable command restores the default configuration.
By default, the address-based NAT server mode is disabled.
Examples: Info: This mode is applicable only to the address-level NAT server.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To ensure that public IP addresses and ports do not need to be allocated from an address pool, run the nat server-mode enable command to enable the address-based NAT server mode.
Configuration Impact
In address-based NAT server scenarios, public IP addresses do not need to be allocated from an address pool.
